name: Is associated Provenance needed?
publisher: Health Level Seven International (Orders and Observations - Structured Data Capture)
description: If true, indicates that QuestionnaireResponse instances created against this questionnaire must have an associated Provenance record.

element.definition: If true, indicates that QuestionnaireResponse instances created against this questionnaire must have an associated Provenance record.
element.comments: Systems may choose to require that the QuestionnaireResponse and referencing Provenance instance be submitted together as a single transaction using Bundle.

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comments: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition should be version specific.  This will ideally be the URI for the Resource Profile defining the extension, with the code for the extension after a #.

element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).
If true, indicates that QuestionnaireResponse instances created against this questionnaire must have an associated Provenance record.
element.comments: Systems may choose to require that the QuestionnaireResponse and referencing Provenance instance be submitted together as a single transaction using Bundle.
